Stem: Rectangular stems with small backwards pointing hairs or prickles along the edges.
Leaves: Lance-shaped in whorls of 4-8 at nodes along stem.
Flowers: Very small, inconspicuous, whitish-green, in clusters of 3 or sometimes 1.
FruitSeeds: Pair of jointed spherical nutlets with a warty texture.
DistinguishingFeatures: Distinguished from the more common Cleavers (*Galium aparine*) by having warty fruit as opposed to fruit with hooked hairs. False Cleavers (*Galium spurium*) is very similar but generally has whiter flowers.
